Pre-Game Insights: Guinea, who finished as the runners-up in 1976, have enjoyed an unbeaten start to the competition.
The reigning champions have got their title defense underway on a positive note recording wins in both their two group-stage games.
Captain Naby Keïta made an appearance from the bench after recovering from a thigh injury and is expected to start here.
Moussa Niakhaté suffered an injury in the campaign opener while Abdallah Sima was injured in training last week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The two West African nations have a long-standing rivalry and have locked horns 59 times across all competitions.
Six of the last seven meetings between them have produced fewer than 2.5 goals, with three clean sheets for each team.
Others: Tip 2: Goals - Over/Under 2.5 Goals - Over 2.5 goals
Tip 3: At least a goal to be scored in the second half - Yes
Tip 4: Ismaïla Sarr to score or assist any time - Yes
